sen.j: 朽木 稙昌（くつき たねまさ）は、常陸国土浦藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Tanemasa KUTSUKI is the second lord of Tsuchiura Domain in Hitachi Province.
Tanemasa KUTSUKI is the second lord of the Tsuchiura Domain in Hitachi Province.
Tanemasa KUTSUKI is the second lord of the Tsuchiura Domain in Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 後に丹波国福知山藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: Later the first lord of Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province
Later the first lord of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province
Later the first lord of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province
The second head of the Kutsuki family in Fukuchiyama Domain.
The second head of the Kutsuki family in the Fukuchiyama Domain.
The second head of the Kutsuki family in the Fukuchiyama Domain.

sen.j: 寛永20年（1643年）5月19日、土浦藩の初代藩主・朽木稙綱（朽木元綱の三男）の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born on July 4, 1643, as the oldest son of Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (the third son of Mototsuna KUTSUKI), the first lord of Tsuchiura Domain.
He was born on July 4, 1643, as the oldest son of Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (the third son of Mototsuna KUTSUKI), the first lord of the Tsuchiura Domain.
He was born on July 4, 1643, as the oldest son of Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (the third son of Mototsuna KUTSUKI), the first lord of the Tsuchiura Domain.

sen.j: 万治3年（1660年）に父が死去したため、翌年に家督を継いで土浦藩の第2代藩主となる。
sen.e: In 1660 his father died, so the next year he succeeded to the family estate and became the second lord of Tsuchiura Domain.
In 1660 his father died, so the next year he succeeded to the family estate and became the second lord of the Tsuchiura Domain.
In 1660 his father died, so the next year he succeeded to the family estate and became the second lord of the Tsuchiura Domain.

sen.j: このとき、弟の朽木則綱に3000石を分与している。
sen.e: On this occasion he distributed 3,000 koku to his younger brother Noritsuna KUTSUKI.
On this occasion he distributed 3,000 koku to his younger brother Noritsuna KUTSUKI.
On this occasion he distributed 3,000 koku to his younger brother Noritsuna KUTSUKI.

sen.j: 寛文7年（1667年）に奏者番に任じられる。
sen.e: In 1667 he was assigned to sojaban (an official in charge of ceremonies).
In 1667 he was assigned to sojaban (an official in charge of ceremonies).
In 1667 he was assigned to sojaban (an official in charge of ceremonies).

sen.j: 寛文9年（1669年）9月、5000石加増の3万2000石で丹波福知山藩に加増移封された。
sen.e: Between September and October in 1669, he was ordered to change his territory with additonal properties of 5,000 koku, totalling 32,000 koku, into Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
In September 1669, he was ordered to change his territory with additonal properties of 5,000 koku, totalling 32,000 koku, into the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: 日付表記修正、the Fukuchiyama Domainとしました。
sen.e: In September 1669, he was ordered to change his territory with additonal properties of 5,000 koku, totalling 32,000 koku, into the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.

sen.j: しかし移封のための出費、天災などにより藩財政が悪化し、元禄4年（1691年）には5ヵ年にわたる家臣の知行の半知を行なっている。
sen.e: However, the financial situation of the domain was deteriorated due to the expenses for the moving, natural disasters, and so on, then in 1691 he conducted hanch (reducing emplyees' payment into half) of enfeoffment for his vassals for five years.

However, the financial situation of the Domain was deteriorated due to the expenses for the moving, natural disasters, and so on, then in 1691 he conducted hanch (reducing emplyees' payment into half) of enfeoffment for his vassals for five years.
sen.cmt: domainの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: However, the financial situation of the Domain was deteriorated due to the expenses for the moving, natural disasters, and so on, then in 1691 he conducted hanch (reducing emplyees' payment into half) of enfeoffment for his vassals for five years.

sen.j: また、足軽の大量解雇や藩札発行の停止などを行なっている。
sen.e: In addition, he executed mass dismissal of ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and suspended to issue han bills (bills usable only in a particular feudal clan), and so on.
In addition, he executed mass dismissal of ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and suspended to issue han bills (bills usable only in a particular feudal clan), and so on.
In addition, he executed mass dismissal of ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and suspended to issue han bills (bills usable only in a particular feudal clan), and so on.

sen.j: 文化の発展にも尽力した。
sen.e: He also contributed to cultural development.
He also contributed to cultural development.
He also contributed to cultural development.

sen.j: 宝永5年（1708年）6月25日、家督を長男の稙元に譲って隠居する。
sen.e: On August 11, 1708, he retired, giving the family estate to his oldest son Uemoto.
On August 11, 1708, he retired, giving the family estate to his oldest son Tanemoto.
On August 11, 1708, he retired, giving the family estate to his oldest son Tanemoto.
He died on April 7, 1714.
He died on April 7, 1714.
He died on April 7, 1714.
He died at the age of 72.
He died at the age of 72.
He died at the age of 72.
